result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody T Byrd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jody T Byrd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jody T Byrd was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jody T Byrd was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
*Pay the DNA & DV (on count 3) surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
*Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
*Provide DNA Sample.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*No contact with victim L.R. unless approved by the agent. Third party contact granted for time with the child as approved by the agent.

*Batterers Intervention program.
*Parenting classes unless verification provided from previously completed course.
*Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jody T Byrd in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Jody T Byrd in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Count 1 previously Dismissed, But Read In. On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 DISMISSED without prejudice.

State complied with victim notification. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties, Lashawnda R., and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes unless verification provided from previously completed course.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim L.R. unless approved by the agent. Third party contact granted for time with the child as approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay the DNA & DV (on count 3) surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, CD-911 call, Sentencing Memorandum, Two transcripts, Sentencing Photos.
Received and Filed, Defense Motion for Continuance.

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
